review_title: Research & development at SISA or SRA Samsung Research America
job_title: Project Leader in San Jose, CA
pros: Competitive salary and bonuses (joining and annual)
cons:
I was a project leader for almost two years and i strongly recommend people to stay away from Samsung Research America, specially researchers due to the following reasons.

1. There is no independence and everything needs to be approved by HQ in South Korea. Upper management in South Korea thinks in terms of hardware and they do not understand software. They are old people with poor understanding of technology and all decisions are taken based on what other US companies are publicly doing

2. People from HQ steal many project ideas as they need to approve them. They will say "please do not work on this item idea because we are already working on it at HQ". Then, they will ran back to HQ and create a project based on your idea or team idea. HQ stole to big projects from my team in just two years.

3. Similarly HQ will also steal the patents generated by you or your team and i have known some instances in which patents submitted from usa to south korea for approval come back with different author names.

4. Finally, since all funding comes from HQ your managers at Samsung research america (usa) will be powerless after all the abuses you suffer. 

In summary, Samsung is a follower company, following the work of leading companies such as apple and this is so embedded in their culture that they even follow and steal ideas from each other within the company.

Stay away please if you are an independent and innovative researcher. Join n american company or startup in the bay area better. You will regret joining and you will remember my advise.

review_title: Not a place to grow or learn.
pros: You will get a timely salary. They have this competency test to keep checking your programming skills. So most people from Samsung you will find good in data structure. Good to show Samsung name on your resume only. You will have good debugging skills if you are given time to do so.
cons:
Proper training is not there. You need to dig out yourself which is not an issue I believe unless someone starts poking you every now and then, like, "what happened to this issue?" , "Did you complete?" and then after some time "do it fast issues are piling up", "What is taking you so much time to do this simple task?".
I joined and left after 4.5 years (I know it sounds stupid but I was scared of the outside world as if I don't know anything, I can't answer any question(something like imposter syndrome) and I admit it). I changed only after every one of my close friends left finally.
The feeling I mentioned above was all because you don't get time to learn ever. If by chance you happen to open a page from where you can learn something, someone will surely poke you and ask "Oh, so you are preparing for an interview?". Gosh!! Micromanagement everywhere. 
They will overload you with the issues and would want you to fix it on that very day. You get issues at 5PM you should finish it even if it takes you 12AM midnight; you stay; you complete; you go. (In some teams of course and unluckily it was mine). You are nothing but a bug fixer in the eyes of HQ guys. But I think you can learn more and get into any flow deeper if you are in Korea or in the Bangalore team than in the Noida office. You get into it, stay for 1.5 years or so and just leave(as most of the new joiners are doing there). Due to their competency test, you can be in touch with DS and try applying in top companies.
